DataElement.preferredName: Local Pathology Review Biospecimen Histologic Grade
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The assignment of a position on a scale of quality to describe the microscopic physical features of cells by a local lab using standardized methods and result criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria.

Concepts.definition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/12/20 jk CPTAC/Linda approved CDE; AI released, RS chg to Qualified.    2/9/20 jk created for CPTAC Local Path Review CRFs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues._A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A morphologic qualifier indicating that the grade of a neoplasm cannot be assessed.

Concepts.definition: A morphologic qualifier indicating that the grade of a neoplasm cannot be assessed.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 8/5/2022: created for PMI EC form. SL

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A term used to describe cells or tissues that do not have specialized ("mature") structures or functions. Undifferentiated cancer cells often grow and spread quickly.

Concepts.definition: Describes tumor cells that generally have lost all of the appearance of normal cells. They tend to grow and spread quickly and aggressively.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Describes tumor cells that generally retain the appearance of normal cells and tend to grow and spread at a slower rate than undifferentiated or poorly differentiated tumor cells.

Concepts.definition: Describes tumor cells that generally retain the appearance of normal cells and tend to grow and spread at a slower rate than undifferentiated or poorly differentiated tumor cells.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 8/5/2022: created for PMI EC form. SL

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Describes tumor cells that have lost some of the appearance of normal cells. They tend to grow and spread at a faster rate than well differentiated tumor cells.

Concepts.definition: Describes tumor cells that have lost some of the appearance of normal cells. They tend to grow and spread at a faster rate than well differentiated tumor cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Describes tumor cells that generally have lost most of the appearance of normal cells. They tend to grow and spread.

Concepts.definition: Describes tumor cells that generally have lost most of the appearance of normal cells. They tend to grow and spread.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 8/5/2022: created for PMI EC form. SL

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to histology.:A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
A position on a scale of intensity or amount or quality.
